Hi,
Using 422 is fine. It isn't defined the HTTP spec but in RFC 2518, whic=
h is as cool. The HTTP spec allows for definition of new HTTP status codes.=
 

422 is used in a number of Web APIs. However, it may not be used as much=
 in new APIs in the future, as the new definition of 400 in HTTP bis makes =
it less needed.

Best,
